definition: A unique identifier for each distinct product and service that can be purchased. Represents the specific variation (e.g., T-Shirt, Red, Large).
The cluster of domain objects including Product, ProductVariants, and ProductAttributes that are treated as a single unit for data changes.
A retailer order for a product that is temporarily out of stock. The customer can purchase it, but shipment is delayed.
Algorithm-based adjustments to product prices based on real-time supply and demand, competitor pricing, or customer segments.
